title: Gullane to North Berwick Walk Route

nearby.description: Coldingham Bay to St Abbs and Coldingham Loch Walk

images.title: Richard Webb / Gullane Bents
images.caption: Gullane Bents. Evening on the dunes. The area in the middle of the photograph has been cleared of the dreaded buckthorn, which has led to the loss of much of the duneland here.

images.title: Richard Webb / Gullane Sands
images.caption: Gullane Sands. Looking straight out to sea across the sandbanks that fill Aberlady Bay. Lomond Hills and a tanker, HS Tosca in the background.

images.title: Richard Webb / Black Rocks
images.caption: Black Rocks. Volcanic outcrop beneath the Gullane dunes. Some of the dunes in this square have been planted with conifers, unattractive, but making a fiendishly difficult orienteering area. View Westward.

images.title: Richard Webb / Muirfield
images.caption: Muirfield golf course seen from Gullane Hill

images.title: Richard Webb, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Fidra Island

images.title: Walter Baxter / Horse riding on Broad Sands
images.caption: Horse riding on Broad Sands. A couple of riders are enjoying a Sunday morning hack along the beach with a canine friend leading the way. The island of Lamb is in the background.

images.title: Richard Webb / Yellowcraig Beach
images.caption: Yellowcraig Beach. Fidra in the background.

description: This circular walk takes you from Gullane to North Berwick using the coastal path on the outward journey and a section of the John Muir Way on the return leg. There's lovely beaches, sand dunes and splendid views across the Firth of Forth to a series of islands, including the RSPB's Fidra Island. The walk starts at the Gullane Bents Car Park next to Gullane Beach. You can then head along the coastal dunes to Black Rocks and the woodland at Jamie's Neuk. You continue north along the famous Muirfield Golf Course , one of the courses used in rotation for The Open Championship. You continue to Weaklow Rocks and Longskelly Rocks where there are fine views north to the Brigs of Fidra and Fidra Island. You continue along Broad Sands before picking up the John Muir Way and following it into North Berwick. You can then follow the inland path west to Gullane, passing the ruined Dirleton Castle on the way. You can continue your walking along the coast path on the Aberlady Bay to Gullane Walk . This will take you along the wildlife rich Aberlady Bay, the first Local Nature Reserve to be founded in Britain in 1952.
